entry.title: The University of the West of Scotland Order of Council 2007
entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to the governance instruments of the University of Paisley consequential on its change of name to the University of the West of Scotland.

entry.title: The Animal Welfare Act 2006 (Commencement No. 2 and Saving and Transitional Provisions) (England) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 1st October 2007 the provisions of the Animal Welfare Act 2006 (“the 2006 Act”) specified in article 2.

entry.title: The Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (No.3) (Wales) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-make with amendments the Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Export Restrictions) (Wales) Regulations 2007. They implement Commission Decision 2007/608/EC which further amends Commission Decision 2007/554/EC concerning certain protection measures against foot-and-mouth disease in the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Seed Potatoes (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Seed Potatoes Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 (S.R. 2001/188) (“the principal Regulations”) as amended by The Plant Health Order (Northern Ireland) 2006, which revokes regulation 22. The principal Regulations regulate the production, classification and marketing of seed potatoes in line with EC requirements. These Regulations amend the principal Regulations to implement in Northern Ireland Council Directive 2002/56/EC on the Marketing of Seed Potatoes (“the Directive”) (O.J. No. L 193 20.07.02, p.60, as last amended by Council Directive 2003/61/EC 18.06.03 O.J. No. L 165, p.23), and which consolidated the much amended Directive 66/403/EEC (O.J. No. l 125 11.07.66, p.154). These Regulations also implement in Northern Ireland Commission Decision 2004/842/EC on the placing on the market of seed belonging to varieties which an application for entry in the national catalogue of varieties of seed potatoes has been submitted (“the National Varieties Decision”) (O.J. No. L 362, 01.12.04, p.21).

entry.title: The Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (Scotland) (No. 3) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-make with amendments the Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Export Restrictions) (Scotland) Regulations 2007.

entry.title: The Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations 2000 (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations 2000 (S.I. 2000/3184) (“the Principal Regulations”). The Principal Regulations implement Council Directive 98/83/EC on the quality of water intended for human consumption (“the Drinking Water Directive”) (OJNoL330, 5.12.1998, p.32) in parts of England and Wales in relation to water supplies by water undertakers and licensed water suppliers, and make further provision about the supply of drinking water.

entry.title: The Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (No.3) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-make with amendments the Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Export Restrictions) Regulations 2007. They implement Commission Decision 2007/608/EC which further amends Commission Decision 2007/554/EC concerning certain protection measures against foot-and-mouth disease in the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Domestic Proceedings) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts (Domestic Proceedings) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1996 (S.R. 1996 No. 324) to enable the court to allow a witness to give evidence through a video link or by any other method of direct communication.

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Children (Northern Ireland) Order 1995) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts (Children (Northern Ireland) Order 1995) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1996 (S.R. 1996 No. 323) to enable the court to allow a witness to give evidence through a video link or by any other method of direct communication.

entry.title: The Police Federation (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police Federation Regulations 1969 by substituting a new regulation 16(4). Under the previous regulation 16(4), where a branch board of the Police Federation held funds exceeding specified amounts at the end of any year, the board was required to pay the excess to the appropriate central committee and, after making such payment, it was permitted to pay such sum as it thought fit to the joint branch board.

entry.title: The Childcare Act 2006 (Commencement No. 3 and Transitional Provision) Order 2007
entry.summary: This is the third Commencement Order made under the Childcare Act 2006 (“the Act”). Article 2 sets out provisions of the Act coming into force on 1st October 2007 to the extent specified in each paragraph. Article 3 is a transitional provision relating to a provision commenced by Article 2(d).

entry.title: The Food for Particular Nutritional Uses (Scotland) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, implement a number of Community instruments relating to foods for particular nutritional uses through amendment of a series of statutory instruments.

entry.title: The Gambling Act 2005 (Club Gaming and Club Machine Permits) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Schedule 1 to the Gambling Act 2005 (Club Gaming and Club Machine Permits) Regulations 2007 (S.I. 2007/1834) to substitute a new form for applications for a club gaming or club machine permit (“a permit”). Changes are made to Section B of the form, which relates to applications made by clubs or miners’ welfare institutes which have been registered under Part 2 or Part 3 of the Gaming Act 1968.

entry.title: The Spring Traps Approval (Variation) (England) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order varies the Spring Traps Approval Order 1995 (“the 1995 Order”) in relation to England only.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (County of Worcestershire) (District of Wyre Forest) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order applies to the whole of the District of Wyre Forest.

entry.title: The Charities (Exception from Registration) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Charities (Exception from Registration) Regulations 1996. They extend the temporary exception granted to certain religious charities from the requirement to be registered under the Charities Act 1993. The temporary exception, which would have originally expired on 1st March 2001, was extended until 1st October 2002 and then again, by the Charities (Exception From Registration) (Amendment) Regulations 2002, until 1st October 2007. These Regulations further extend the temporary exception until 1st October 2012 and revoke the 2002 Regulations.

entry.title: The Custodial Sentences and Weapons (Scotland) Act 2007 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Commencement Order brings into force sections 58, 60(1)(a) and (b), 61 to 63 and 66(2) and schedule 5 to the Custodial Sentences and Weapons (Scotland) Act 2007 (“the 2007 Act”). Sections 58, 60(1)(b), 66(2) and schedule 5 are only brought into force for certain specified purposes.

entry.title: The Education (Listed Bodies) (England) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order lists the name of every body which is not a recognised body within section 216(4) of the Education Reform Act 1988 (the “1988” Act) but which appears to the Secretary of State either–

entry.title: The Education (Recognised Bodies) (England) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order lists all those bodies which appear to the Secretary of State to be recognised bodies within section 214(2)(a) or (b) of the Education Reform Act 1988. These are universities, colleges or other bodies which are authorised by Royal Charter or by or under Act of Parliament to grant degrees and other bodies for the time being permitted by those bodies to act on their behalf in the granting of degrees. An award granted by such a body is not an award of a kind referred to in section 214(1), which makes it an offence to grant, offer to grant, or issue any invitation relating to certain unrecognised degrees and awards.

entry.title: The Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) Regulations 1999 (“the principal Regulations”).
